required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Monitoring of the Bone Free Flaps With Microdialysis
clinical_study.official_title: Monitoring of the Bone Free Flaps With Microdialysis

brief_summary.textblock: Microdialysis is admitted to be reliable by numerous surgeons to monitor flaps. Nevertheless, a few authors reported follow up with microdialysis in bone free flaps, and they all describe the position of the catheter in the surrounding soft tissue muscle which is not the accurate reflect of bone vascularisation. The aim of this study is to determine the lactate/pyruvate ratio mean value in bone free flaps with a microdialysis catheter directly positioned in the bone tissue.

detailed_description.textblock:
Failure rate of facial reconstructive surgery with bone free flaps varies between 11 and 25%. In case of buried bone free flaps, the follow up is even more difficult. Monitoring methods, such as the implantable Doppler system, laser Doppler flowmetry and microdialysis have been developped in the last 15 years. Ferguson et al. show a false positive rate of 31% with implantable doppler monitoring of buried flaps.
The purpose of this study is to to determine the lactate/pyruvate ratio mean value in bone free flaps with a microdialysis catheter directly positioned in the bone tissue.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline of lactate/pyruvate ratio in patients without free flap ischemia
primary_outcome.time_frame: every hour during the day of surgery
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline of lactate/pyruvate ratio in patients without free flap ischemia

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline of lactate/pyruvate ratio in patients without free flap ischemia
primary_outcome.time_frame: every 2 hours at day 1 after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline of lactate/pyruvate ratio in patients without free flap ischemia

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline of lactate/pyruvate ratio in patients without free flap ischemia
primary_outcome.time_frame: every 3 hours at days 2, 3 , 4 and 5 after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline of lactate/pyruvate ratio in patients without free flap ischemia

secondary_outcome.time_frame: every hour during the day of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Metabolites measurement are glucose, lactate , pyruvate and glycerol rates.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 2 hours at day 1 after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Metabolites measurement are glucose, lactate , pyruvate and glycerol rates.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 3 hours at days 2, 3 , 4 and 5 after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Metabolites measurement are glucose, lactate , pyruvate and glycerol rates.

intervention.description: Glucose values will be recorded during 5 days as following : every hour at day 0, every 2 hours at day 1, every 3 hours at days 2 to 5.
Lactate values will be recorded during 5 days as following : every hour at day 0, every 2 hours at day 1, every 3 hours at days 2 to 5.
pyruvate values will be recorded during 5 days as following : every hour at day 0, every 2 hours at day 1, every 3 hours at days 2 to 5.
glycerol values will be recorded during 5 days as following : every hour at day 0, every 2 hours at day 1, every 3 hours at days 2 to 5.
Bone free flaps will be monitored with a microdialysis catheter directly positioned in bone tissue.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult person
- signed informed consent
- head and neck reconstruction with iliac crest or fibula free flap
- patient covered by national health insurance
Exclusion Criteria:
- minor person
- head and neck reconstruction with other types of free flaps than crest or fibula free flap
- pregnant or breastfeeding women
